caption:
This photograph captures a rural agricultural setting, depicting two people engaged in the task of drying or processing a large amount of what appears to be shrimp, spread out on a surface under the open sky. The person on the left, a man, is using a large rake to possibly turn over or spread out the shrimp. He is dressed casually in long, light-colored pants, a short-sleeved shirt, and a bucket hat. The person on the right, appearing to be a woman, is also involved in similar activity, using a shovel-like tool. She wears darker, loose-fitting trousers, a light-colored blouse, and her hair is tied back.

The environment around them features a large, predominantly white building with elements of industrial or farm-type construction, including an open doorway and noticeable framework supports. A smaller roofed structure adjoining the main building is partially visible. Utilities such as wooden poles and power lines are evident in the background, which also shows a clear, lightly clouded sky.

The foreground is almost entirely covered with shrimp, implying that the image is taken during a significant harvesting or processing period. This setting suggests a shrimp farm or a similar operation dedicated to seafood processing. The overall scene conveys a sense of manual labor in an agricultural or aquacultural industry, set in a spacious, open-air environment.
title: Drying shrimp
